===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|おう|か|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=おうか}} {{m|zh|櫻花}}.

====Pronunciation====
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{ja-pron|おうか}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おうか|kyu=櫻花|hhira=あうくわ}}

# a [[cherry]] [[blossom]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|桜花爛漫|おうか らんまん}}: cherry blossoms in full bloom

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|さくら|はな|k2=ばな|yomi=k|r=y}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=さくらばな}}. Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=さくらばな|桜|tr1=sakura|t1=cherry tree|花|tr2=hana|t2=blossom, flower}}. The ''hana'' changes to ''bana'' due to {{rendaku|さくらばな}}.

====Pronunciation====
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{ja-pron|さくらばな}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さくらばな|kyu=櫻花}}

# a [[cherry]] [[blossom]]
